section: WHEREAS, the Trust wishes to engage Domini to provide certain oversight, administrative and management services, and Domini is willing to provide such oversight, administrative and management services to the Trust on the terms and conditions hereinafter set forth;
explanation: While the recitals state Domini provides "oversight, administrative, and management services", Section 1(j) only lists "arranging for and preparing annual renewals for fidelity bond and errors and omissions insurance coverage". This is an omission, since the WHEREAS indicates the Sponsor should be providing services related to the investment itself, but the detailed duties of the sponsor do not describe this oversight, creating an in-text contradiction.

section: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Sponsor shall also be fully responsible for, the management of the Trust's assets including rendering of investment advice and supervision with respect thereto or the distribution of shares of any series, nor shall the Sponsor be deemed to have assumed or have any responsibility with respect to functions specifically assumed by any transfer agent, custodian, fund accounting pricing agent or shareholder servicing agent of the Trust.
explanation: This paragraph contradicts the overall nature of the agreement, which describes the Sponsor as providing oversight, administrative and management services, and lists several specific duties.  The phrase "the Sponsor shall NOT be fully responsible for, the management of the Trust's assets including rendering of investment advice and supervision with respect thereto or the distribution of shares of any series" nullifies the original intentions of the Sponsor as the one providing management services. This is an in-text contradiction.

section: The Sponsor shall be liable for any error of judgment or mistake of law or for any act or omission in the oversight, administration or management of the Trust or the performance of its duties hereunder, except for willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence in the performance of its duties, or by reason of the reckless disregard of its obligations and duties hereunder. As used in this Section 4, the term "Sponsor" shall include Domini and/or any of its affiliates and the directors, officers and employees of Domini and/or any of its affiliates.
explanation: This creates an inconsistency by broadly exempting the Sponsor from liability, except in cases of "willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence".  However, the Sponsor has a fiduciary duty to act with reasonable care and skill. This would be an Omission of legal terms.
